intro: Hemitelia parvula, commonly known as the small-leaved hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub with small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with white or pale pink petals. Hemitelia parvula is notable for its medicinal properties, as it has been used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects.
